content: समाधा {c3c} <ab>U.</ab> {@--1@} To place or put together, join, unite. {@--2@} To place, put, put or place upon, apply to; पदं मूर्ध्नि समाधत्ते केसरी मत्तदंतिनः <ls>Pt. 1. 327.</ls> {@--3@} To install, place on the throne; <ls>R. 17. 8.</ls> {@--4@} To compose, collect (as the mind); मनः समाधाय निवृत्तशोकः <ls>Rām.</ls>; न शशाक समाधातुं मनो मदनवेपितं <ls>Bhāg.</ls> {@--5@} To concentrate, fix or apply intently upon (as the eye, mind &c.); <ls>Bg. 12. 9</ls>; <ls>Bh. 3. 48.</ls> {@--6@} To satisfy, clear or solve (a doubt), answer an objection; इति समाधत्ते (in commentaries). {@--7@} To repair, redress, set right, remove; न ते शक्याः समाधातुं <ls>H. 3. 37</ls>; उत्पन्नामापदं यस्तु समाधत्ते स बुद्धिमान् <ls n="H.">4. 7.</ls> {@--8@} To think over; <ls>Bk. 12. 6.</ls> {@--9@} To entrust, commit to, deliver over. {@--10@} To produce, effect, accomplish. {@--11@} To place a burden, load. {@--12@} To assume, take upon oneself. {@--13@} To conceive (in the womb). {@--14@} To establish.
